title: 106_s1153
content: Rural Telecommunications Improvement Act of 1999 - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to establish within the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) the Office of Rural Advocacy, to be headed by the Rural Advocate of the FCC, to: (1) promote access to advanced telecommunications service for rural populations. And (2) undertake related functions and activities. Requires: (1) annual reports from the Rural Advocate to Congress, the President, and the FCC. And (2) an initial report from the Advocate to Congress on actions taken to carry out this Act.
